docs.lead_paragraph: In the spring of 1982, a baby with Down's syndrome and an incomplete esophagus was born in Indiana. His parents, supported by the courts, decided he should not be fed. ''Infant Doe'' died when he was six days old.

headline.main: Baby Doe Needs No Big Brother

docs.snippet: In the spring of 1982, a baby with Down's syndrome and an incomplete esophagus was born in Indiana. His parents, supported by the courts, decided he should not be fed. ''Infant Doe'' died when he was six days old.
